1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Cream the Rapper is waxing lyrical in his local corner shop; Kev the Witch is getting his house valued by a local estate agent; Jonny Nash the Ladies Man is using his unique chat-up lines at a local speed dating event; Alan the Care Home Worker is reading his elderly residents a story; and Joel the Trainspotter is waiting to see his favourite train. Superheroes the Knight Warriors are waiting for a bus; Garth the Life Coach is giving some practical self-improvement tips; Dorota the Actress and her husband/manager Atonu are showcasing their acting skills; Talina the ...

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Jonny Nash the Ladies Man tries to be a male escort and pole dancer; Kev the Witch buys a new car; Cream the Rapper gets a job cleaning his mother's house so he can pay her some rent; and Joel the Trainspotter spots buses. Alan the Care Home Worker gives his elderly residents an exercise class; superheroes the Knight Warriors debate the merits of sun and rain; Louis the Stripper tries to rent a room in a shared house; and Garth the Life coach gives some practical kitchen advice. 3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Cream the Rapper gets a job working in the library so he can pay his mum some rent; Kev the Witch tries to buy a new mobile phone; Alan the Care Home Worker gives his elderly residents a life drawing class; Jonny Nash the Ladies Man tries to meet some new ladies in the gym; superheroes the Knight Warriors debate the merits of the TV show 60 Minute Makeover; Garth the Life coach tries to rewire the hardwire in his brain. 4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Dorota the Actress and her husband/manager Atonu showcase their skills in some adaptions of famous film scenes; Talina the Temptress tries to blag herself a free sports car; Cream the Rapper gets a job working in his local supermarket; and Joel the Trainspotter is spotting Volvos. Kev the Witch tries to get some money off a new broom; Jonny Nash the Ladies Man tries to seduce the ladies in his local swimming pool; Alan the Care Home Worker plays bingo with his residents; and superheroes the Knight Warriors wonder if they've left the iron on. 5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Talina the Temptress and Louis the Stripper go on a blind date; Dorota the Actress and her husband/manager Atonu showcase their acting skills in the Dilemma Scene; Cream the Rapper has got a job as a tour guide so he can pay his mum some rent; and Joel the Trainspotter is spotting chihuahuas. 6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Kev the Witch tries to find a new 'witches familiar' in his local pet shop; Talina the Temptress and Jonny Nash go on a blind date; Dorota the Actress and her husband/manager Atonu showcase their acting skills in the Mermaid Scene; Cream the Rapper performs in a garden centre; and Alan the Care Home Worker celebrates his birthday with his elderly residents. imdb.plot outline: "Boom Town" is a hybrid TV show that combines comedy, fantasy, and reality. Each episode features real-life people playing their most eccentric alter-egos in their own specific sketches. The players are: Alan (sketch "Care Homeworker"), Anthony (sketch "The Pub Landlord"), Cream (sketch "The Rapper"), Dorota and Atonu (sketch "An Acting Showreel"), Garth (sketch "Life Coach"), Joel (sketch "The Trainspotter"), Jonny Na$h (sketch "Ladies' Man"), Kev (sketch "The Witch"), Knight Warriors (sketch "Superheroes"), Louis (sketch "The Stripper", Pablo (sketch "The Romantic"), Stella (sketch "Fashion Designer"), and Talina (sketch "The Temptress").
imdb.title: Boom Town
plot: "_Boom Town_ (qv)" is a hybrid TV show that combines comedy, fantasy, and reality. Each episode features real-life people playing their most eccentric alter-egos in their own specific sketches.
